description: Reconfiguration of 3No. existing 2nd floor residential units, alterations to the existing window to front elevation to form doorway and single storey extension to 1st floor of flank elevation to extend existing stairwell.
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

No, meter boxes, antennas, satellite dishes, soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall be fixed to the (street) elevations of the building other than as shown on the drawings hereby approved.


REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved, a scheme to secure the occupation of the building as a car-free development shall be submitted to, and agreed in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall make explicit that all occupiers of the development (not being holders of a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to Section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 or similar legislation) including all such future occupiers, shall not apply for, or hold, an on-street parking permit to park a vehicle on the public highway at any time within the administrative district of the Local Planning Authority. Any permit that is issued to or held by any occupant of the development shall immediately be surrendered to the Local Planning Authority. The restrictions and requirements of the scheme shall apply to and be communicated to all future occupiers of the development, including successors in title, as well as any person occupying the premises as a tenant or licensee. The scheme shall be in in place prior to the first occupation of the development and retained in force thereafter.</p><p>REASON: To avoid cumulative impacts and further pressure on car parking supply and demand in a location that is within a Controlled Parking Zone</p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; text-align: justify; line-height: 13.91px;"><font face="arial, sans-serif">Construction Management Plan&nbsp;</font></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 13.91px;"><font face="arial, sans-serif">No development shall take place until a detailed Construction Management Plan covering the matters set out below has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Environmental Protection Team. &nbsp;&nbsp;The plan must demonstrate the adoption and use of the best practicable means to reduce the effects of noise, vibration and dust from the site.&nbsp; &nbsp;The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the details and measures approved as part of the construction management plan, which shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period.&nbsp;</font></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 13.91px;"><font face="arial, sans-serif">The construction management plan covering all phases of the development shall include but not be limited to the following:</font></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 13.91px;"><font face="arial, sans-serif"><br></font><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">- A method statement covering all phases of construction of the project to include details of noise, vibration and dust control measures.&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 13.91px;"><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;"><br></span><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">- Details and locations of all noisy activities including mobile plant machinery, and details of the best practicable means of mitigation employed&nbsp; &nbsp;against noise and vibration in accordance with British Standard Code of Practice BS 5228.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 13.91px;"><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;"><br></span><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">- Details of the locations where deliveries will be undertaken; the size and number of lorries expected to access the site daily; the access arrangements (including turning provision if applicable); construction traffic routing; details of parking suspensions (if required) and the duration of construction.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 13.91px;"><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;"><br></span><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">- Deliveries to site and associated with removal of plant, equipment, machinery and waste from the site must only take place within the permitted hours detailed above.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 13.91px;"><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;"><br></span><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">- Procedures for maintaining good public relations including complaint management, public consultation and liaison - Arrangements for liaison with the Council’s Community Safety Team.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 13.91px;"><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;"><br></span><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal;">-&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">A waste management plan setting out how resources will be managed and waste controlled at all stages.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 13.91px;"><font face="arial, sans-serif">&nbsp;</font></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; text-align: justify; line-height: 13.91px;"></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 13.91px;"><font face="arial, sans-serif"><b>Reason:</b>&nbsp;To ensure that occupiers of residential premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance during site activities</font></p>

line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">30 dB L<sub>Aeq</sub></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><br></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><br></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><br></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><br></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><br></p><br><p>Before commencement of the use hereby permitted a test shall be carried out to show the standard of sound insulation required shall be met and the results submitted to the Environmental Protection Team for approval.</p><p>Reason:&nbsp;To ensure that the occupiers and users of the proposed development do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of excess environmental noise.</p>

<p>Extract System Design&nbsp;</p><p>No development shall commence on the premises until detailed plans and specifications of the equipment comprising an extract ventilation system, which shall include details of: external appearance (to show that the flue terminates at least 1m above the roof eaves or dormer window of the building housing the commercial kitchen), and measures to alleviate noise, vibration, fumes and odours (incorporating active carbon filters, electrostatic precipitators, silencer(s), and anti-vibration mountings where necessary) have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The system shall be installed in accordance with the approved plans and specifications before the use commences, and shall thereafter be permanently maintained in accordance with the approved plans and specifications. Further guidance can be obtained from Guidance on the Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems, DEFRA, 2005.</p><p><br></p><p>Reason:&nbsp;To ensure that the occupiers and users of the proposed development do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of excess environmental noise</p>

<p>Mechanical plants:</p><p>The total noise level from fixed plants shall be 10 dB(A) or more below the measured LA90 level at the nearest noise sensitive premises at any time. The method of assessment shall be carried in accordance with. BS4142: 2014:&nbsp;Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound.&nbsp; Before commencement of the use hereby permitted a test shall be carried out to show that the above criterion shall be met and the results submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.</p><p><br></p><p>Reason:&nbsp;To ensure that the occupiers and users of the proposed development do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of excess environmental noise.</p>

<p>Residential/Commercial Soundproofing</p><p><br></p><p>The following level of sound insulation i.e. Rw 60dB is required for the building elements separating the commercial and residential components of the development. We require a test report to demonstrate this level has been achieved.&nbsp; By virtue of the commercial properties above residential in this development, a higher level of sound insulation is required compared to advice given in Approved Document E of the Building Regs for residential developments alone.&nbsp;&nbsp;Above all, there is a need for them to submit a construction management plan to show how noise, vibration or dust will be managed so that sensitive premises near the site do not suffer from noise or vibration or dust.</p><p><br></p><p>Reason:&nbsp;To ensure that the occupiers and users of the proposed development do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of excess environmental noise.</p>

The roof of the extension hereby approved shall not be used as a terrace, balcony or similar amenity area.


REASON: In the interests of neighbours amenity
subdivision_of_building:
Front 2nd floor.
Part 1st floor west elevation.
Part ground floor front elevation.
